This file is a merged representation of the entire codebase, combined into a single document by Repomix.

================================================================
File Summary
================================================================

Purpose:
--------
This file contains a packed representation of the entire repository's contents.
It is designed to be easily consumable by AI systems for analysis, code review,
or other automated processes.

File Format:
------------
The content is organized as follows:
1. This summary section
2. Repository information
3. Directory structure
4. Multiple file entries, each consisting of:
  a. A separator line (================)
  b. The file path (File: path/to/file)
  c. Another separator line
  d. The full contents of the file
  e. A blank line

Usage Guidelines:
-----------------
- This file should be treated as read-only. Any changes should be made to the
  original repository files, not this packed version.
- When processing this file, use the file path to distinguish
  between different files in the repository.
- Be aware that this file may contain sensitive information. Handle it with
  the same level of security as you would the original repository.

Notes:
------
- Some files may have been excluded based on .gitignore rules and Repomix's configuration
- Binary files are not included in this packed representation. Please refer to the Repository Structure section for a complete list of file paths, including binary files
- Files matching patterns in .gitignore are excluded
- Files matching default ignore patterns are excluded

Additional Info:
----------------

================================================================
Directory Structure
================================================================
.github/
  workflows/
    main.yaml
.gitignore
.gitpod.yml
index.js
main.mustache
package.json
README.md

================================================================
Files
================================================================

================
File: .github/workflows/main.yaml
================
name: README build

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 */6 * * *'

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout current repository to Master branch
        uses: actions/checkout@v4 # Updated to v4
      - name: Setup NodeJs 16.x
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4 # Updated to v4
        with:
          node-version: '16.x'
      - name: Cache dependencies and build outputs to improve workflow execution time.
        uses: actions/cache@v4 # Updated to v4
        with:
          path: node_modules
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-js-${{ hashFiles('package-lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-js-
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm install
      - name: Generate README file
        run: node index.js
      - name: Commit and Push new README.md to the repository
        uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v5 # Replaced with git-auto-commit
        with:
          commit_message: 'docs: auto-update README.md'
          # Optional: specify the file pattern to commit
          # file_pattern: README.md
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

================
File: .gitignore
================
node_modules/
.env

================
File: .gitpod.yml
================
# This configuration file was automatically generated by Gitpod.
# Please adjust to your needs (see https://www.gitpod.io/docs/introduction/learn-gitpod/gitpod-yaml)
# and commit this file to your remote git repository to share the goodness with others.

# Learn more from ready-to-use templates: https://www.gitpod.io/docs/introduction/getting-started/quickstart

tasks:
  - init: yarn install

================
File: index.js
================
const Mustache = require('mustache')
const fs = require('fs')
const fetch = require('node-fetch')
require('dotenv').config()
const MUSTACHE_MAIN_DIR = './main.mustache'

const DATA = {
	name: 'Tarun Yadav',
	date: new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-GB', {
		weekday: 'long',
		month: 'long',
		day: 'numeric',
		hour: 'numeric',
		minute: 'numeric',
		timeZoneName: 'short',
		timeZone: 'Europe/Stockholm',
	}),
	surename: 'Yadav',
	location: 'Delhi, India',
	temperature: '',
}

const weather = async () => {
	return await fetch(
		`https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?q=delhi&appid=${process.env.API}&units=metric`
	)
}

weather()
	.then((res) => res.json())
	.then((weatherData) => (DATA.temperature = weatherData.main?.temp))
	.then(() => generateReadMe())

function generateReadMe() {
	fs.readFile(MUSTACHE_MAIN_DIR, (err, data) => {
		if (err) throw err
		const output = Mustache.render(data.toString(), DATA)
		fs.writeFileSync('README.md', output)
	})
}

================
File: main.mustache
================
<h1>Hey, 👋 I'm {{ name }}</h1>

<p>Hi, I'm a <b>Frontend Developer </b> currently working in blockchain space.</p>

Ping me on twitter: <a href="https://twitter.com/tarunyadav9761">@tarunyadav9761</a>, if you want to talk about web3, tech, or anything else.

 <h3>Current Location Temperature</h3>
 <p> {{ location}} {{ temperature}}* C </p>

File: package.json

{
  "name": "tarunyadav1",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "README file",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/tarunyadav1/tarunyadav1.git"
  },
  "author": "Tarun Yadav",
  "license": "ISC",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/tarunyadav1/tarunyadav1/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/tarunyadav1/tarunyadav1#readme",
  "dependencies": {
    "dotenv": "^8.2.0",
    "mustache": "^4.0.1",
    "node-fetch": "^2.6.1"
  }
}

================
File: README.md
================
<h1>Hey, 👋 I'm Tarun Yadav</h1>

<p>Hi, I'm a <b>Frontend Developer </b> currently working in blockchain space.</p>

Ping me on twitter: <a href="https://twitter.com/tarunyadav9761">@tarunyadav9761</a>, if you want to talk about web3, tech, or anything else.

 <h3>Current Location Temperature</h3>
 <p> Delhi, India * C </p>
